titles: Live Ukraine Updates: Calling Off Steel Plant Assault, Putin Prematurely Claims Victory in Mariupol
descriptions: Russia's president said he would blockade rather than storm the Mariupol factory where Ukrainian forces were holding out, but a soldier in the plant said shelling continued. President Biden said the U.S. was sending more weapons to help Kyiv.

titles: Macron and Le Pen Trade Punches in Pivotal French Election Debate
descriptions: He attacked the far-right leader as a Putin stooge. She hit back at him as the president of division and contempt.

titles: This Spanish Village Has More Booksellers Than School Pupils
descriptions: Urueña, in northwestern Spain, has fought depopulation by reinventing itself as a literary hub. The full-time population is still just 100, but there are 11 shops selling books.

titles: Gazan Militants and Israeli Air Force Exchange Fire
descriptions: The flare-up followed a rise in tensions over holy places in Jerusalem and a deadly wave of Arab attacks in Israel, answered by a lethal Israeli crackdown in the occupied West Bank.

titles: Explosion at Afghan Mosque Kills at Least 10
descriptions: The blast in Mazar-i-Sharif, one of Afghanistan's economic hubs, was the latest in a series of attacks on one of its religious minorities and was claimed by an ISIS affiliate.

titles: How Hated Is Macron? It Could Decide the French Election.
descriptions: Given the choice between a president they suspect of despising ordinary people and a far-right candidate they detest, many French voters may stay home.

titles: S​outh Korea's Supreme Court ​Issues Landmark Ruling on Gay Sex
descriptions: ​The court said that the military should not punish consensual sex acts that had taken place in a nonmilitary setting.

titles: Why China's Security Pact With the Solomon Islands is a Threat
descriptions: In potentially opening the door to a Chinese military base, the Solomon Islands threatens the balance of power in a vital shipping region.

titles: U.K. Court Order Moves Assange Closer to Extradition
descriptions: The court formally ordered the extradition of the WikiLeaks founder to the United States, but it still needs approval from a British cabinet minister and his defense can appeal to her directly.

titles: Deep in Colombia, Rebels and Soldiers Fight for the Same Prize: Drugs
descriptions: The country signed a historic peace deal more than five years ago. But a power vacuum is fueling the rise of new armed groups competing to control the drug trade.

titles: France's Presidential Election 2022: Your Runoff Questions, Answered
descriptions: President Emmanuel Macron will face Marine Le Pen, the far-right leader, in the runoff on Sunday. The outcome will be crucial for France and reverberate globally.

titles: Housing Crisis Propels High Death Toll in South Africa Floods
descriptions: The catastrophe underscored an overlooked reality in the fight against extreme weather: Protecting people is as much about tackling social issues as environmental ones.

titles: 6 Rohingya Refugees Are Killed Fleeing Detention Center in Malaysia
descriptions: In recent years, the Malaysian government has taken a more hard-line approach to the refugees in the country, which once offered a modicum of opportunity.

titles: He Was a Penniless Donor to the Far Right. He Was Also a Russian Spy.
descriptions: An investigation in Slovakia has exposed how Russian clandestine operations are trying to sow discord in Europe and create sympathy for Moscow over Ukraine.

titles: Putin Claims Victory in Mariupol, Calling Off Steel Plant Assault
descriptions: With casualties mounting and progress slow in his war on Ukraine, Vladimir V. Putin is eager to present it to the Russian people as a success.

titles: Next Phase of War Will Be Pivotal for Russia and Ukraine, U.S. Says
descriptions: Reflecting a renewed sense of urgency, President Biden announced that the United States would send the Ukrainians $800 million more in military aid.

titles: Your Friday Briefing: Putin's Defensive Speech
descriptions: The Russian leader claimed victory in Mariupol, despite Ukrainian resistance.

titles: US Braces for Potential French Election Shockwave
descriptions: An upset victory by the right-wing nationalist Marine Le Pen in the presidential election on Sunday could scramble President Biden's foreign policy.

titles: What to Know About the Weapons Being Sent to Ukraine
descriptions: The Biden administration is sending dozens of howitzers and 120 drones in the latest $800 million package of military aid.

titles: Mikhail Vasenkov Dies at 79; His Spy Ring Inspired 'The Americans'
descriptions: He and his wife were among 10 Soviet sleeper agents who blended into American society before being exposed and deported in 2010. The TV series sprung from the episode.

titles: Biden Announces $800 Million in Military Aid and Questions Russia's Hold of Mariupol
descriptions: President Biden said President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia would “never succeed in dominating” Ukraine.

titles: US Is Extending Vaccine Rule for International Travelers at Land Borders
descriptions: Unlike air travelers entering the United States, land and ferry travelers will still not have to show a recent negative coronavirus test to cross the border.

titles: Perils of Invisible Government
descriptions: The American Rescue Plan is huge and yet little noticed.

titles: With Moskva Warship Sunken, Russia Disinformation Faces a Test
descriptions: Families of missing crew members say the Russian authorities are giving them the runaround after a flagship sank last week in the Black Sea.

titles: Kangaroos in India? Experts See Evidence of a Smuggling Trade
descriptions: The animals are the latest exotic fauna to be smuggled into the country, possibly to be used as pets. Draft legislation would close loopholes in the roaring wildlife trade.

titles: Your Thursday Briefing
descriptions: A Russian missile test with a message.

titles: See Mariupol's Azovstal Steel-Mill Fortress Before the War, and Now
descriptions: Before-and-after images show the scale of destruction that the Ukrainian port city has suffered after nearly two months of near constant bombardment by Russian artillery, mortars and airstrikes.

titles: Russia Tests ICBM and Pounds Ukraine's Defenses Ahead of Major Assault
descriptions: Vladimir Putin said Russia's test-firing of its new I.C.B.M. sends a message, as his forces prepare for a broad offensive in eastern Ukraine.

titles: Russia's Missile Test Fuels U.S. Fears of an Isolated Putin
descriptions: American and foreign leaders have been weighing whether their success in making Russia a diplomatic pariah could push President Vladimir V. Putin to strike in new ways.

titles: What Mariupol's Steel Fortress Looked Like 3 Months Ago
descriptions: On Jan. 20, The New York Times captured drone video over the sprawling Azovstal Steel and Iron works complex in Mariupol, Ukraine. Now, it is a battered fortress for the last Ukrainian defenders.

titles: People Should Keep Wearing Masks in Public, W.H.O. Officials Say
descriptions: Masks have been proven to be highly effective at reducing coronavirus transmission when used properly, according to the W.H.O.

titles: Rosario Ibarra de Piedra, 95, Dies; Fought for Mexico's 'Disappeared'
descriptions: When her son vanished in 1975, she began a crusade on behalf of him and hundreds of others and became a voice of moral authority on the left.

titles: Your Thursday Briefing: Russia Threatens Escalation
descriptions: Plus the emergence of armed militias in Colombia and questions over China's Covid death toll.

titles: Residents in Avdiivka, Ukraine Go Underground as Russia's Assault on East Ramps Up
descriptions: As Ukrainian forces dig into trenches and residents flee into basements, Russia's artillery attacks have intensified. “They can't get through the front lines and so they're starting simply to destroy the city,” a Ukrainian official said.

titles: Barack Obama Takes On a New Role: Fighting Disinformation
descriptions: The former president has embarked on a campaign to warn that the scourge of online falsehoods has eroded the foundations of democracy.

titles: Calls to Give Heavy Weapons to Ukraine Divide Germany's Government
descriptions: Weeks after Chancellor Olaf Scholz announced a paradigm shift in military strategy, his government is struggling to balance domestic politics, how to help Ukraine and anxiety over provoking Russia. that

titles: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen walked out of a G20 meeting as Russia's finance minister spoke.
descriptions: Several central bank governors and finance ministers protested Russia's participation at the spring meetings of the I.M.F. and World Bank.

titles: Prince Harry Said He Wants to Make Sure Queen Is 'Protected'
descriptions: The prince, in Europe for the Invictus Games, visited his grandmother then told the “Today” show that he wanted to make sure “she's protected.”

titles: Russia Said It Has Successfully Tested a New ICBM That Can Evade Defenses
descriptions: Though officials said the missile is not yet ready to deploy, President Vladimir V. Putin said the launch of the Sarmat missile “will force all who are trying to threaten our country in the heat of frenzied, aggressive rhetoric to think twice.”

titles: Why 'Border Control' Politics Is More About Control Than Borders
descriptions: A quirk of political psychology helps explain the British government's plan to send some asylum seekers to Rwanda.

titles: Myanmar faces a health emergency as its military regime targets doctors.
Can Ukraine Keep Winning?
descriptions: As a new phase of the war begins, we look at Russia's advantages — and Ukraine's.

titles: Ukrainians Far From Home Struggle to Protect Family With Dementia
descriptions: Millions of Ukrainians have been displaced since the war started. Many elderly or disabled people have been unable or unwilling to leave their homes.

titles: Shanghai's Low Covid Death Toll Revives Questions About China's Numbers
descriptions: The country's largest city has recorded just 17 Covid deaths, despite surging cases. How China defines a Covid death may be part of the reason.

titles: Your Wednesday Briefing
descriptions: Russia's offensive in eastern Ukraine.

titles: Russia Rejects Calls for a Cease-Fire to Enable Evacuations From Ukraine
descriptions: Civilians, including children, remain trapped in the eastern Ukraine region of Donbas and in the devastated port city of Mariupol.

titles: Russia Embarks on a New, More Cautious Phase of Ukraine War
descriptions: Despite the Kremlin's new methodical approach focusing on eastern Ukraine, the Russian military still faces some of the same problems that hampered it after the war began.

titles: Your Wednesday Briefing: Russia Bombards the East
descriptions: Moscow's military offensive in eastern Ukraine has begun.

titles: The U.S. Races to Arm Ukraine With Heavier, More Advanced Weaponry
descriptions: Washington and its allies are scouring Central Europe and the world to get Ukraine the weapons it needs for the next phase of the war.

titles: Star Ferry, 'Emblem of Hong Kong,' May Sail Into History After 142 Years
descriptions: Launched in 1880, the ferry has witnessed both Hong Kong's transformation into a global financial hub and its history of protests. But battered by a pandemic, the service is struggling to survive.

titles: Johnson Is All Apologies Before Parliament After 'Partygate' Fine
descriptions: Though opposition politicians called him out, only one member of his own Conservative party called on him to resign.

titles: Biden Says It's 'Up to Them' Whether Americans Want to Wear Masks
descriptions: The decision to wear a mask is “up to them,” President Biden told reporters during a trip.

titles: Huge Steel Plant in Mariupol Is a Fortress for Ukrainian Holdouts
descriptions: A huge Soviet-era steel mill is where the last Ukrainian defenders of Mariupol have taken refuge as Russia's battle to take full control of the city appeared to be entering its final stages.

titles: Inside 'The Burnt City,' Punchdrunk's Take on the Fall of Troy
descriptions: Punchdrunk's “The Burnt City” adds techno and sake to the story of the fall of Troy, but it brought in a scholar of classical theater to get the details right.

titles: Letizia Battaglia, Photographer of Mafia Brutality, Dies at 87
descriptions: Her images of victims on the streets of Palermo were stamped on the nation's consciousness as she challenged the grip mobsters had on her native Sicily.

titles: Here's how to handle some of the most irritating workplace habits when you return to the office.
